alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Mercer; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:35PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Ocean, southeastern Mercer, northeastern Burlington, Monmouth, southwestern Middlesex and southeastern Bucks Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 735 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Tinton Falls to Vista Center to Jacksonville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Trenton, Long Branch, Asbury Park, Lakewood, Jackson, Howell, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Manasquan, Hightstown, Point Pleasant Beach, Bordentown and Cranbury. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 6 and 8A. Pennsylvania Turnpike near mile marker 359. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 34. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 48 and 66. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 89 and 111. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern, central and northern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Mercer; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Western Monmouth
